title: Ford will launch Renault-based small EVs in Europe
author: Nick Gibbs
summary: The EVs will be engineered and produced by Renault at Ampere’s ElectriCity plant in France, with Ford overseeing the design as well as the ride and handling characteristics.

title: Suppliers to the new Skoda Kodiaq
summary: Production of the midsize SUV is expected to peak at nearly 139,000 next year.

title: Asbury CEO David Hult to step down in May; COO Dan Clara to lead dealership group
author: John Huetter
summary: The CEO change from David Hult to Dan Clara, which Asbury called “the culmination of the Board’s long-term leadership succession plan,” will take effect after Asbury’s annual stockholder meeting in May.

title: BMW, Toyota oppose EU’s proposed CO2 targets for business fleets
author: Reuters News
summary: The European Union's latest proposals for cutting CO2 emissions could include mandatory targets for electric vehicle purchases for corporate fleets, a move opponents say will be "highly damaging."

title: Rivian CEO RJ Scaringe interview; six EU leaders call to stop ICE ban
author: Kellen Walker
summary: In the first part of an exclusive interview with Automotive News, Rivian CEO RJ Scaringe says the auto industry is on the verge of a self-driving revolution. Six countries call on the European Union to abandon its 2035 ICE ban. Plus, Canadian auto retailers have poured millions into electric vehicle infrastructure upgrades, but many say there’s been no return on investment.

title: Daily 5 report for Dec. 8: The battle to ease emissions rules isn’t just being fought in America
author: Omari Gardner
summary: After last week’s widely expected news that the Trump administration is proposing relaxed U.S. fuel economy standards, several developments in Europe signal dissatisfaction in that market’s regulatory landscape.

title: How smarter aftersales strategies deliver results: Service view case study
summary: In response to industry challenges and declining new vehicle sales, dealership leaders aimed to increase service retention and aftersales revenue. Additionally, as part of an OEM corporate initiative, they focused on growing customer-paid service work to achieve 100% service absorption.

title: Aftersales in the EV Future: Plan now to realize tomorrow’s potential
summary: A recent Harris Poll commissioned by Urban Science shows that global auto buyers recognize electric vehicles (EVs) as the most impactful innovation shaping the future of the automotive industry. Despite this shift, a strong majority across the U.K., Germany, and the U.S. still value personal vehicle ownership. Government regulations, especially in Europe, are accelerating the transition to EVs, with significant growth in sales projected in the near future.

title: Editorial: Stellantis hiring spree a welcome turnabout for metro Detroit
author: Crain's Detroit Business
summary: News that Stellantis is on a hiring spree of white-collar workers in Auburn Hills is a welcome change.

title: First Shift: GM envisions cars as personal assistants
author: Kellen Walker
summary: Volvo: Growth returning in 2026 | Toyota revives Lexus LFA | Scout Motors service strategy

title: Auto Supply Chain Performance: The Hidden Gaps Costing OEMs Billions
summary: BCG’s new perspective highlights the seven capabilities that define high-performing automotive supply chains illustrated through real-life examples and focused deep dives from our recent work.

title: Aisin spending $11M on Ontario plant to build panoramic sunroofs for Lexus NX
author: David Kennedy
summary: The investment in new equipment will shift work currently done in Asia to North America.

title: 5 Revenue Secrets Every Dealership Needs to Know Heading Into 2026
summary: Discover how top-performing dealerships are capturing untapped revenue opportunities through smarter pricing, disciplined processes, and connected performance insights.

title: Mercedes GLB: Electric debut for an overlooked contender
author: Michael Gerster
summary: The electric Mercedes GLB delivers up to 631 km (392 miles) of range, likely setting a benchmark in its class.

title: Automakers fall short of end-of-year rush as China sales drop second straight month
author: Bloomberg News
summary: Retail vehicle sales fell about 8 percent to 2.2 million in November, the China Passenger Car Association said, mainly due to a 22 percent slump in sales of gasoline cars, with new-energy vehicle volume up 4.2 percent.

title: Automotive News Video: Volvo targets growth in 2026
author: Douglas A. Bolduc
summary: Volvo Cars CEO Håkan Samuelsson says the automaker is ready to return to growth in 2026 after falling short of last year's record 700,000 global sales.

title: Best practices for leveraging the power of AI at auto dealerships
summary: Many dealers are grappling with how to fully harness the potential of artificial intelligence (AI) while at the same time minimizing the possible risks. There are a myriad of things to consider: What’s the best way to introduce AI to employees?

title: LexisNexis Risk Solutions VP on the changing face of car buyer loyalty: What OEMs must do next
summary: Loyalty isn’t what it used to be—and new research from LexisNexis Risk Solutions reveals that only 31% of car buyers still behave like true brand loyalists. In this episode, host Emma Hancock speaks with Dave Nemtuda, Assistant Vice President, Connected Car, who breaks down why loyalty is fragmenting, how multi-brand households are reshaping the market, and what predictive garage insights mean for the future of retention.

title: Lexis Nexis VP on the changing face of car buyer loyalty: What OEMs must do next

summary: Archive of digital edition for 12-8-2025

title: Former Volkswagen exec launches self-named line of gin
author: Jack Walsworth
summary: The VW Group veteran left Seat and Cupra in March.

title: Mercedes hires former VW strategy chief Stefan Weckbach to lead AMG
author: Micha Gebhardt
summary: Stefan Weckbach helped shape Porsche’s EV roadmap and was once considered a contender for the CEO role. He will now steer AMG’s electrification plans as it aims to launch its first full-electric sports car next year.

title: What Stellantis CEO Antonio Filosa is seeking in EU auto package
author: Peter Sigal
summary: Stellantis is pushing for rules to support commercial vans and small cars, as well as measures to speed up the renewal of Europe's aging car fleet.

title: Volvo CEO predicts 2026 sales rebound, calls U.S. ideal market for electrification
author: Douglas A. Bolduc
summary: Hakan Samuelsson says the EX30, EX90 and XC70 will lead the comeback. He also is bullish about long-range plug-in hybrids gaining traction in Europe and the U.S.

title: Canadian dealers spent millions on EV infrastructure for few sales
author: Greg Layson
summary: One group has spent as much as $4.5 million on store upgrades while one dealer in Western Canada spent $200,000 on one dealership, but electric-vehicle sales continue to slump.

title: BMW iX3 Neue Klasse: What the new EV delivers in battery tech, computing and dynamics
author: Thomas Geiger
summary: The iX3 is the first software-defined vehicle to launch using BMW's new Neue Klasse tech platform. Here are key impressions from a first drive of the midsize electric SUV.

title: EU confirms auto package that could weaken 2035 ICE ban is delayed to Dec. 16
author: Reuters News
summary: Automakers and governments have asked the EU revise its 2035 zero emissions policy that would ban sales of new combustion engine cars.

title: As AI fuels new cyber threats, can dealerships and vendors stay ahead?
author: Mark Hollmer
summary: Cybercriminals eventually find new ways to attack. The challenge for dealerships and their tech vendors is to keep their protections current.

title: Six EU countries call for abandoning 2035 combustion engine ban
author: Bloomberg News
summary: Prime ministers including Italy's Giorgia Meloni and Poland’s Donald Tusk demanded that an upcoming revision of EU rules for new cars allow plug-in hybrids, range extenders and fuel-cell technology after the 2035 zero-emission deadline.

title: Bonus Episode: Steps dealers should take before picking AI vendors
summary: Part Two of Automotive News Retail Reporter Mark Hollmer’s interview with Yuriy Demidko, chief information officer at Fox Motors, outlining the steps dealers need to take when selecting a vendor for artificial intelligence tools.

title: RJ Scaringe: How Rivian is navigating tariff impacts
author: Laurence Iliff, Molly Boigon
summary: RJ Scaringe, Rivian’s CEO, joins the Automotive News “Shift” podcast to talk about how Rivian reduced its tariff impacts.

title: VW CEO Oliver Blume signals investment cuts as cash flow tightens
author: Micha Gebhardt
summary: VW's latest investment plan focuses on Europe but it could include a U.S. plant for Audi and a Porsche model built in China.

title: Weekend Drive: Is Trump’s CAFE rollback moot?
author: Kellen Walker
summary: Auto industry leaders joined President Donald Trump at the White House to announce proposed rollbacks of Biden-era fuel economy standards. Automotive News’ Larry P. Vellequette and Michael Martinez talk about that and other news from the past week, including Toyota’s leap back into supercars.

title: Former Bollinger executive sues EV automaker
author: Eric Freedman
summary: A former executive at EV automaker Bollinger Innovations sued the company, alleging retaliatory discharge, breach of contract and whistleblower violations.

title: Daily 5 report for Dec. 5: Trump weakens CAFE rules
author: Wes Raynal
summary: The Trump administration's proposed federal fuel economy standards give automakers a reprieve from stringent emissions rules but prompts some analysts and environmental organizations to say the change could mean the return of the gas-guzzler.

title: Top 5 Canadian auto stories this week: New Dodge Charger output; November sales slump; auto job losses; more
summary: Here's a rundown of the week's top stories as determined by reader interest.

author: Kellen Walker
summary: President Donald Trump wants Asian kei cars to be built and sold in the U.S. Toyota leaps back into supercars. Plus, service and parts consultant Vernon Davis talks about his new book about how to implement mobile service at a dealership.

summary: Mazda’s upmarket strategy pays off | New dealership group’s ambitious plans | Trump greenlights kei cars

summary: Scout Motors' ambitious service and parts plan will center on factory-run service centers.

summary: Advances in GM's driver-assistance technology, AI, computing and software will work together to make a driver's life easier and more personalized.

title: Hyundai Canada appoints Ken Maisonville as COO
author: David Kennedy
summary: Maisonville will oversee sales, marketing and aftersales for the Hyundai brand in Canada.

title: Carney, Trump, Sheinbaum to meet at 2026 World Cup draw in Washington
author: Canadian Press
summary: The 2026 World Cup draw will mark the first time all three leaders have gathered in person. It comes ahead of next year's mandatory review of the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement.

Centennial guest essay by Bill Ford: Legendary Mustang means freedom, optimism to generations around the world
author: Bill Ford
summary: Bill Ford describes the evolution and global impact of the Ford Mustang.

author: Leo Michael
summary: Republicans on the Commerce, Science and Transportation Committee plan to hold a hearing Jan. 14 on vehicle affordability.

title: Tesla seeks Europe sales rebound with low-cost Model 3
author: Peter Sigal
summary: The Model 3 Standard drops ambient lighting, a rear touchscreen and other comfort features to reach below-€37,000 pricing as Tesla battles falling sales and cheaper Chinese EVs in Europe.

title: Volvo, Tesla supplier Luminar gears up for debt restructuring
author: Bloomberg News
summary: Luminar’s struggles come amid growing cracks in the supplier sector, as the industry grapples with tariffs and a shifting outlook for EVs.

title: Cupra’s €26,000 Raval takes aim at Renault 5 in Europe’s small EV market
author: Andrea Malan
summary: The Raval will be the first EV to launch from VW's Electric Urban Car family. The car targets younger buyers with performance-focused tuning.

title: VW to convert Dresden EV factory to AI, chip tech center
author: Bloomberg News
summary: VW's Dresden factory will be a research center for artificial intelligence and robotics after the phase out of ID3 production.

title: ANC Podcast: Dec. 5, 2025 | The week’s top stories and Laura Zanchin talks EV investment, sales, rebates, more
summary: November sales slide; New Charger output starts; USMCA under scrutiny. Plus, Zanchin Automotive Group Principal and Executive Director Laura Zanchin talks EV investment, sales, rebates and more.

title: Toyota leaps back into supercars with gasoline-powered GR GT/GT3; Lexus LFA resurrected as EV
author: Larry P. Vellequette, Hans Greimel
summary: Toyota will leap back into supercars with three new entries on a shared architecture due in about 2027. The GR GT and GR GT3 will be powered by a high-output twin-turbo V-8, while the Lexus LFA is expected to be reborn as an EV, perhaps with a solid state battery.

title: Stellantis getting notice of default from Canada following production shift to U.S., Joly says
author: Canadian Press
summary: Stellantis’ production shift breaches federal contracts tied to manufacturing in Brampton and Windsor, Ont., Industry Minister Mélanie Joly told the international trade  committee.

title: Unlock dealer success: Harness market data for profitable decisions in today’s automotive landscape
summary: Today’s most successful dealerships aren’t just adapting to change—they’re anticipating it with real-time market intelligence. Cox Automotive research shows that data-driven dealers outperform their peers with smarter pricing, faster inventory movement, and stronger profitability in a volatile market.

title: Simple steps to achieve faster deals and better experiences for car buyers
summary: Today’s buyers expect speed, transparency, and flexibility—Dealertrack’s Digitization Guide reveals how dealerships can deliver all three with surprisingly simple workflow upgrades. Learn how small digital shifts can remove friction, accelerate deals, and create a smoother experience for both your team and your customers.

title: Unlock shopper satisfaction with precision: Build the experience today’s buyers expect
summary: Car buyers want more control, more clarity, and more confidence—and top dealers are meeting that demand with precision, not guesswork. VinSolutions’ latest guide reveals the four key drivers of shopper satisfaction and shows how data-backed strategies can transform every touchpoint of the buying journey.

title: Customer Incentives – 12/08/25
summary: National customer cash back and finance rate programs listed by automaker, brand and model; updated weekly

title: The AI Moment: Why standing still isn’t an option in automotive
summary: AI is reshaping automotive retail faster than any technology before it, and dealers who fully commit are already seeing 50% stronger performance across sales, operations, and profitability. With 81% saying adoption was easier than expected, the real risk isn’t moving too fast—it’s falling behind.

title: Automotive News Video: Trump slashes fuel economy rules
author: Jake Neher
summary: The proposed rule would also reclassify crossovers and small SUVs as passenger vehicles instead of light trucks.

title: Daily 5 report for Dec. 4: Domestic brands continue to struggle in Consumer Reports rankings
author: Jerry Hirsch
summary: Consumer Reports bases its analysis on its own road tests and owner survey results that covered 380,000 vehicles.

title: U.S. sales stumbles continue in November as affordability woes deepen
author: Michael Martinez, David Phillips
summary: While the overall market fell for the second consecutive month, some brands such as Toyota and Kia posted modest gains driven by strong demand for hybrids and lower-priced models.

title: Car Pros Automotive sells 3 stores to Canadian Go Auto
author: Gail Kachadourian Howe
summary: Car Pros Automotive Group sold its three dealerships in Washington, according to a Dec. 4 LinkedIn post from CEO Matthew Phillips. Those stores sell Kia and Hyundai vehicles.

title: How dealers should shop for AI tools; Trump unveils relaxed CAFE standards
author: Kellen Walker
summary: Yuri Demidko, chief information Officer at Fox Motors, outlines the steps dealers need to take before settling on new artificial intelligence tools for their stores. President Donald Trump unveils his plan to slash fuel economy rules. Plus, dealer sentiment sinks as the tariff rush fades and tax credits end.

title: Identifying & Training the Next-Generation EV Workforce
summary: The rapidly growing EV industry needs workers with a diverse set of skills, beyond the traditional industry occupations. These include computer programmers, EV maintenance technicians, chemical engineers, software developers and materials engineers. Companies will find some of those workers already trained and ready – working in adjacent sectors. They also can turn to colleges, many of which are now taking a more aggressive role in preparing these next generation workers.

title: U.S. loyalty rates by make, as of Sept. 2025
summary: U.S. loyalty rates by make as of a certain date.

title: CDK’s Service Shopper Study: Trends Shaping the Service Experience
summary: CDK’s annual Service Shopper study offers a fresh lens from 2,000+ customers into how Service departments are performing, what matters most to today’s shoppers, and where the biggest chances for growth lie. From appointment friction to loyalty trends, this year’s results reveal a complex picture, one that demands attention, adaptation and action.

summary: Volkswagen’s Seat-Cupra subsidiary, which produces the Tavascan all-electric crossover in China and exports to Europe, warns that new EU tariffs pose a serious threat to its business.

author: Dan Shine
summary: Dealers' views of current and future service and parts business dropped in the latest Cox Automotive Dealer Sentiment Index.

title: Trump moves to slash fuel economy rules with automaker support
author: Molly Boigon
summary: The planned presence of the Detroit 3 and automotive stakeholders at the Oval Office announcement shows how times have changed regarding vehicle emissions.

title: Changan set to launch Avatr, Nevo EV brands in Europe, executive says
author: Reuters News
summary: Chongqing-based Changan joins a growing number of Chinese automakers in Europe, including China’s No. 1 car company, BYD, and the country’s top exporter, Chery, as well as EV makers Xpeng and Zeekr.

title: EU reviews removing tariffs on VW electric cars built in China
author: Reuters News
summary: VW's Seat/Cupra subsidiary, whose Tavascan electric SUV is built in China, has warned that the tariff poses a serious threat to its business.

summary: Rivian CEO RJ Scaringe says autonomy will redefine vehicle ownership before the decade's end.

title: Trump wants Asia’s ‘cute’ kei cars to be built and sold in America

summary: While the ultra-compact cars are highly popular in Japan, they currently don’t meet federal standards for new vehicles in the U.S.

author: Laurence Iliff
summary: Rivian is developing self-driving features as CEO RJ Scaringe says giving drivers “time back” will shift market share, echoing Tesla’s playbook.

title: Tesla China shipments rise for just the third time in 2025
author: Bloomberg News
summary: Tesla's November shipments from a Shanghai plant totaled 86,700 in November, up 10 percent from a year earlier, and the second-highest tally for the company this year, trailing only September’s wholesale deliveries.

title: Consumer Reports: Toyota is most reliable brand while Ford sees best result in 15 years
author: Richard Truett
summary: Toyota and Subaru consistently rank highest in quality rankings because they make incremental changes, said Jake Fisher, Consumer Reports senior director of auto testing.

title: Guest commentary: Why the first dealers to experiment with AI will have advantages
author: Nick Cossette
summary: AI is reshaping auto retail as early-adopter dealerships tighten response times, test new workflows and build compounding advantages in leads, loyalty and margins that late adopters will struggle to match.

title: Dealers are key to carmakers’ success
summary: A mutually trusting relationship consistently build over 50 years cannot be duplicated overnight, writes Jim Press.

title: Nissan shops for partnerships, but not one-way deals

summary: Nissan brings some unique technology to the negotiating table, including an electrified body-on-frame platform that could support up to five new models.

title: New auto retailer LTA Auto Group, backed by investment group, buys first dealerships, seeks to grow to 50-plus stores
author: Gail Kachadourian Howe
summary: LTA Auto Group bought its first two dealerships, both in California, with plans to buy more in that state, then expand into other states.

title: Gasoline-powered Dodge Charger returns as first models roll off the line in Windsor, Ont.
author: David Kennedy
summary: Stellantis plans to hire about 1,500 workers in Windsor to meet demand for its expanded lineup of muscle cars.

title: How a once-struggling Mitsubishi store more than doubled annual sales in a decade
author: Doug Firby
summary: Sales were once so slow, staff had to show photos to buyers and then bring in physical vehicles from other Mitsubishi dealerships.

title: Why the next wave of software-defined vehicles will be cheaper to make, have fewer delays
author: Lois Hoyal, Douglas A. Bolduc
summary: VW, Renault and Hyundai will benefit from the costly, time-consuming mistakes made by rivals when launching early-generation SDVs, a top tech supplier boss said.

title: CEO RJ Scaringe: Rivian’s next phase hinges on mass-market R2 and advanced autonomy
author: Laurence Iliff
summary: Four years after launching high-end R1 vehicles, Rivian enters a new phase with the R2 crossover, advanced software and an autonomy push, CEO RJ Scaringe says.

summary: Mazda CEO Masahiro Moro outlines plans to return to profitability after a big tariff hit and revises his outlook for electric vehicles.

title: Scout’s arrival in South Carolina has executive teaching college engineering course

summary: Scout Motors' growing presence in South Carolina now includes an executive teaching a university course.

title: Why Mazda CEO Masahiro Moro’s ‘retail-driven’ strategy has succeeded
author: Hans Greimel
summary: Upmarket brand migration is a holy grail of many mass-market automakers. Mazda CEO Masahiro Moro may have cracked the code.

title: Car industry bets EU will delay announcement on combustion-engine cut-off, report says
author: Reuters News
summary: Industry sources have joined EU Transport Commissioner Apostolos Tzitzikostas in suggesting an announcement on the support package may not take place on Dec. 10.

title: France pushes EU to support local EV production in auto relief deal
author: Bloomberg News
summary: The government wants EVs sold in Europe to include 75 percent of locally sourced parts, in line with the current content levels for ICE vehicles.

title: German importers lobby group sees EV incentives as key to sales growth in 2026
author: William Boston
summary: The VDIK says if Berlin meets its demands for subsidy adjustments, the BEV market could raise its share to 25.5 percent, enough to “just about meet” fleet CO2 limits.

title: What BMW CEO Oliver Zipse wants from the EU’s auto rescue package
author: Peter Sigal
summary: The European market cannot reach the EU's 100 percent zero emissions goal by the 2035 target date, BMW's Zipse said. He called on regulators to implement life cycle carbon assessment, along with provisions for plug-in hybrids and sustainable fuels.

title: Canada’s Element Fleet Management buying vehicle payment technology firm Car IQ
author: Canadian Press
summary: Element helps companies manage fleets of vehicles.

title: Daily 5 report for Dec. 3: Don’t choose affordability over safety
author: Wes Raynal
summary: It could be quite the important day for the auto business Jan. 14. That’s when Senate Republicans plan to hold a hearing on one of the industry’s biggest issues: vehicle affordability.

title: Edmunds’ Jessica Caldwell on state of the market; Trump set to ease fuel economy standards
author: Kellen Walker
summary: Jessica Caldwell, head of insights at Edmunds, talks about the state of the industry heading into 2026 and how affordability issues have continued to shrink the new car market. Trump is poised to propose relaxed fuel economy standards. Plus, thousands of dealerships fall victim to a new data breach.
